title: Failing to build a new compiler on Arch Linux
body:
I am new to spack and would like to use it to maintain toolchains on my personal computer that runs Arch Linux.

When running `spack install gcc@4.9.4` I get the following output:

```
==> Installing gcc
==> Installing gmp
==> Installing m4
==> Installing libsigsegv
==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.10.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.10.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.10.tar.gz failed.
==> Trying to fetch from ftp://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.10.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/libsigsegv-2.10-3z7l7dwctrsrkfjyzrlbxot3wdi5i47c/libsigsegv-2.10.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/libsigsegv-2.10-3z7l7dwctrsrkfjyzrlbxot3wdi5i47c
==> No patches needed for libsigsegv
==> Building libsigsegv
==> Successfully installed libsigsegv
  Fetch: 3.07s.  Build: 4.50s.  Total: 7.57s.
  [+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/libsigsegv-2.10-3z7l7dwctrsrkfjyzrlbxot3wdi5i47c
  ==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/m4/m4-1.4.17.tar.gz
  curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/m4/m4-1.4.17.tar.gz
  ==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/m4/m4-1.4.17.tar.gz failed.
  ==> Trying to fetch from ftp://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/m4/m4-1.4.17.tar.gz
  ######################################################################## 100.0%
  ==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/m4-1.4.17-djado3nz53qarulwkrvwqdt76sp2lumd/m4-1.4.17.tar.gz
  ==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/m4-1.4.17-djado3nz53qarulwkrvwqdt76sp2lumd
  ==> Applied patch pgi.patch
  ==> Building m4
  ==> Successfully installed m4
    Fetch: 7.05s.  Build: 16.43s.  Total: 23.49s.
    [+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/m4-1.4.17-djado3nz53qarulwkrvwqdt76sp2lumd
    ==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/gmp/gmp-6.1.1.tar.bz2
    curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/gmp/gmp-6.1.1.tar.bz2
    ==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/gmp/gmp-6.1.1.tar.bz2 failed.
    ==> Trying to fetch from https://gmplib.org/download/gmp/gmp-6.1.1.tar.bz2
    ######################################################################## 100.0%
    ==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/gmp-6.1.1-mfgftrcf67zhnx7n5i2v35jnsppgxusv/gmp-6.1.1.tar.bz2
    ==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/gmp-6.1.1-mfgftrcf67zhnx7n5i2v35jnsppgxusv
    ==> No patches needed for gmp
    ==> Building gmp
    ==> Successfully installed gmp
      Fetch: 11.69s.  Build: 29.22s.  Total: 40.91s.
      [+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/gmp-6.1.1-mfgftrcf67zhnx7n5i2v35jnsppgxusv
      ==> Installing mpc
      ==> Error: Specs gmp@6.1.1%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux--x86_64^libsigsegv@2.10%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux--x86_64^m4@1.4.17%gcc@6.2.1+sigsegv arch=linux--x86_64 and gmp@6.1.1%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-None-x86_64 have the same SHA-1 prefix!

```

and for `spack install llvm@3.7.1`:

```
Installing llvm
==> Installing cmake
==> Installing bzip2
==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/bzip2/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/bzip2/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/bzip2/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz failed.
==> Trying to fetch from http://www.bzip.org/1.0.6/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-io2vyo4mfep3yf5weburjaolzakn6hdq/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-io2vyo4mfep3yf5weburjaolzakn6hdq
==> Ran patch() for bzip2
==> Building bzip2
==> Successfully installed bzip2
  Fetch: 0.62s.  Build: 1.78s.  Total: 2.40s.
[+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/bzip2-1.0.6-io2vyo4mfep3yf5weburjaolzakn6hdq
==> Installing expat
==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/expat/expat-2.2.0.tar.bz2
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/expat/expat-2.2.0.tar.bz2
==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/expat/expat-2.2.0.tar.bz2 failed.
==> Trying to fetch from http://downloads.sourceforge.net/project/expat/expat/2.2.0/expat-2.2.0.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/expat-2.2.0-cgclksyqryobyjlj6qvuerrjyklbybvf/expat-2.2.0.tar.bz2
==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/expat-2.2.0-cgclksyqryobyjlj6qvuerrjyklbybvf
==> No patches needed for expat
==> Building expat
==> Successfully installed expat
  Fetch: 0.77s.  Build: 5.69s.  Total: 6.45s.
[+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/expat-2.2.0-cgclksyqryobyjlj6qvuerrjyklbybvf
==> Installing ncurses
==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/ncurses/ncurses-6.0.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/ncurses/ncurses-6.0.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/ncurses/ncurses-6.0.tar.gz failed.
==> Trying to fetch from http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/ncurses/ncurses-6.0.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/ncurses-6.0-olzhep66cydod34fff25iku2h5ikwerq/ncurses-6.0.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/ncurses-6.0-olzhep66cydod34fff25iku2h5ikwerq
==> Applied patch patch_gcc_5.txt
==> Building ncurses
==> Successfully installed ncurses
  Fetch: 4.46s.  Build: 32.85s.  Total: 37.32s.
[+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/ncurses-6.0-olzhep66cydod34fff25iku2h5ikwerq
==> Installing zlib
==> Trying to fetch from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/zlib/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /spack/var/spack/cache/zlib/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///spack/var/spack/cache/zlib/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz failed.
==> Trying to fetch from http://zlib.net/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.8-whgndqgsqofl6rmnmlkyigosqhnsdmf3/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.8-whgndqgsqofl6rmnmlkyigosqhnsdmf3
==> No patches needed for zlib
==> Building zlib
==> Successfully installed zlib
  Fetch: 2.16s.  Build: 1.74s.  Total: 3.90s.
[+] /spack/opt/spack/linux--x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/zlib-1.2.8-whgndqgsqofl6rmnmlkyigosqhnsdmf3
==> Installing openssl
==> Error: Specs zlib@1.2.8%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux--x86_64 and zlib@1.2.8%gcc@6.2.1 arch=linux-None-x86_64 have the same SHA-1 prefix!
```

I have no clue what to do with this kind of error (did not find anything in the docs or the issue tracker). By the may, my default compiler is gcc-6.2.1 as you may already see in the output. I would be happy to hear your ideas on this.
